Edward Boyce.Action: Keeps pace with his fellow paratroopers despite fear, shows determination in a stressful situation.
Notices emotional British soldiers crying and pays attention, indicating empathy and sensitivity.
Speaks kindly to Ford with a gentle, truthful tone ('The truth?'), showing warmth and concern.
Lowers his head in silent prayer before the operation, reflecting sincerity and a respectful nature.
Threw his class ring into an envelope for his family, showing thoughtfulness and care.
Starts friendly conversations with others on the plane to ease tension and connect.
Keeps his footing and hooks himself onto the anchor line under intense enemy fire and chaotic conditions, maintaining composure.
Responds quickly and confidently when asked if he was hit, indicating alertness and awareness.
Expresses disappointment in himself after nearly losing his rifle and hesitation; shows responsibility in continuing the climb despite fear.
Compliments Ford on good shooting in a calm and sincere manner.
Cuts Ford loose from parachute to help him, showing willingness to assist a comrade.
Catches Ford after he falls, preventing him from serious injury.
Remains silent and attentive, follows Ford down the tree without complaint, shows vigilance when footsteps approach, demonstrates patience and discipline under stress.
Freezes when footsteps approach, shows caution which suggests concern for group safety rather than recklessness.
Silently eyes Ford, moves with caution and readiness during tense encounter.
Brushes past Chloe along with Ford without acknowledging her hope or emotional reaction.
Hisses at the wolf to protect the dead pilot's body, showing assertiveness but not aggression.
Urgently calls for Tibbet and kneels beside the mortally wounded Gurkin, trying to help him despite the hopeless situation.
Offers water to Gurkin and tries to comfort him under extreme stress.
Hesitates and refuses to assist Gurkin's wish to be put out of misery despite the pilot's begging.
Hisses at the wolf to deter it from the animal traps, showing awareness of surroundings and some control.
Keeps trying to help severely wounded Gurkin, attempting to give him water and organize aid despite obvious hopelessness.
Appears overwhelmed and shakily pulls out a canteen; struggles to maintain composure under pressure.
Hesitates and debates internal moral dilemma about putting Gurkin out of misery.
Cannot bring himself to shoot Gurkin despite immense pressure, shows visible remorse by apologizing and closing Gurkin's eyes.
Follows squad members and communicates clearly with others, indicating cooperation and friendliness.
Spots and picks up an important dagger with SS markings, showing awareness and curiosity.
Drops to a knee and attempts to respond to rifle fire by rising and stepping down the ramp despite being alone, indicating cautious engagement with the threat.
Appears stunned and confused after the explosion and subsequent chaos, showing momentary hesitation and lack of clear action.
Exhibits situational awareness by noticing the klaxon and emergency lights and reacts by taking off up the ramp, indicating understanding of exposure and need to retreat.
Grabs Tibbet to pull him out of danger despite the risk, urges him to move quickly.
Quickly recognizes danger and takes immediate action to pull Tibbet behind cover, evading the searchlight and potential enemy detection.
Moves tactically by using terrain (tree, cover) and shows awareness of enemy positions.
Runs toward cover under stress and maintains focus despite surrounding chaos and enemy presence.
No indication of hesitation or confusion; responds promptly to emergencies and coordinates with others (Tibbet).
Insists on going to find Ford despite orders to stay put, showing concern for a comrade.
Reacted with horror and distress at the discovery of the headless dog, indicating sensitivity.
Freezes and stays cautious when confronted by German soldiers, showing self-preservation but no hostile behavior.
Helps Ford climb over to the window and tends to his injured ankle by seeking an axe as instructed
Expresses fear about the plan (terrified) but still agrees to participate
Observes carefully and voices concerns about the strange atmosphere in the town ('something's off')
Suggests getting children out of harm's way.
Does not push further after Chloe's hesitation regarding her father's crutch.
Accepts Ford's rebuke and focuses on the mission.
Quickly checks his gear methodically before heading out, steeling himself despite anxiety.
Shows emotional restraint by controlling himself and focusing on the mission rather than engaging in discussion.
Acknowledges the importance of destroying the church to cover their tracks, agreeing confidently to the task.
Shows limited engagement with Chloe's emotional story, noting the photo only briefly before refocusing on the mission.
Drops to his belly at the attic steps, preparing to defend, showing readiness to protect others.
Processes information quickly, stays focused in a crisis to protect others.
Nods at Annelise when Ford sees her, quietly attentive and observant.
Watches Wafner and Bruel for their reaction during tense moments, showing vigilance and calm presence.
Stares in disbelief at Annelise's black blood without showing strong emotional response or intervention.
Nods knowingly when observing unexpected or tense situations, watches key players closely for reactions.
Passively watches events unfold without intervening despite signs of extreme tension and danger around him.
Responds to Chloe's desperate plea with a flushed face and a half-nod, showing emotional sensitivity and some restraint.
Corrects Paul's English brusquely: 'Your English needs some work, kid.'
Shows hope and determination to 'fight' for Chloe and her family despite personal danger.
Starts firing in an ambush to eliminate threats (Kogan, Kiebel, Mueller) and then carefully searches the church for Dr. Bruel, showing concern.
Remains perfectly still and low to the ground after the ambush, without showing panic or unnecessary aggression.
Winces slightly upon seeing the stripped, dead German soldiers showing gunshot wounds
Turns off the gas stove to stop further harm in the lab
Observes the victims silently, appearing shocked and speechless but does not intervene directly at that moment
Stares at tortured creature with a sense of something drawing him toward it
Responds to a distressed voice by checking another curtained-off section and recognizing a fellow American
Tells Rosenfeld 'Okay. We're gettin' you outta here' and starts untying him despite the danger
Anxiety pumping as he tries to help a tortured prisoner
Identifies Rosenfeld quickly, attempts to assist and untie him despite anxiety.
Stares uncertainly at the blistered creature, unsure how to respond.
Turns his back after untying Rosenfeld, leading to being ambushed and knocked out by Dr. Bruel.
Is observed to be in trouble on the battlefield, causing Ford to act urgently to help him.
Resists interrogation silently, showing resilience but no friendliness or warmth.
Shares a meaningful look with Rosenfeld, indicating connection and silent support among prisoners.
Remains silent under interrogation but does not retaliate aggressively or betray others.
Questions if the 'villager-creatures' are being re-Germanized too, showing concern for others.
Prays for strength during torture, showing internal resilience but no outward hostility.
Appeals to Bruel's identity (reminding him he is French) perhaps to invoke empathy or hesitation.
Strikes Bruel suddenly and decisively to protect himself and Rosenfeld.
Immediately attempts to help Rosenfeld after attacking Bruel.
Lugs injured Rosenfeld into the Laurent home seeking help, urgently calls out for assistance.
Shows concern and relief upon Ford's arrival, indicating reliance on others and valuing their presence.
Expresses relief and concern when Ford arrives injured, asks about his leg.
Does not retaliate when Ford yells at him, chooses not to fire back despite being hurt.
Threatens prisoner Wafner with a gun to his head to extract information.
Shakes his head in disbelief, processes the gravity of the situation silently
Tells Ford to stop and questions his aggressive approach toward Wafner
Jumps in front of Wafner to protect Chloe; fires shots at Wafner to stop him from taking her away; throws a grenade out of the room to avoid harm to others.
Stops Ford to warn him about mines, leading him carefully through danger.
Shares honest concern and uncertainty about the unknown dangers below the blast-doors.
Manages physical discomfort without abandoning the mission or alarming others.
Nods and helps Ford to his feet after a tense fight.
Is entirely unaware when Ford slips something into his pocket, showing trust in Ford.
Nods numbly and proceeds to follow Ford's orders without hesitation.
Fires at Wafner strategically, blind him to protect others.
Charges Wafner despite own pain to neutralize threat.
Uses grenades to protect Chloe and fight off Kogan.
Warns Chloe to turn away for her safety before breaking her chain.
Grabs Chloe and pulls her along the railing while ducking gunfire, showing quick thinking and protective instincts.
Leads Chloe into the stairwell and then into an armory room, attempting to find a way to escape or defend themselves.
Throws a grenade which turns out to be ineffectual, indicating a failed or poorly executed attempt at offense.
Holds Chloe's hand and reassures her despite the dangerous situation, demonstrating leadership and confidence.
Ends up trapped between enemies with no clear escape route or immediate plan to counterattack, showing limited strategic options under pressure.
Keeps trying to reason with Ford despite being shot at; tries to calm Ford and remind him of his identity.
Drops the flashlight in darkness and knocks over a beaker while stumbling.
Approaches a locked door under fire but unable to open it and gets injured.
Maintains attempts to de-escalate, even when Ford is hostile and dangerous.
Hesitates to use violence but ends up butt-ending Ford to defend himself.
Cries while repeatedly trying to stop Ford from attacking, pleading that this is not the person Ford wants to be.
Faces a dire choice to complete the mission at the risk of his own life, showing dedication and concern for comrades.
Dives to shelter Chloe and her near-lifeless father from the explosion and collapsing building.
Hurries to Chloe's side after recognizing her wounded state, takes her hand, expresses concern and sympathy.
Acknowledges Chloe's suffering gently, apologizes for her loss.
Keeps pace with his stick despite fear and heavy gear, showing discipline and endurance.
Is terrified and acknowledged as just a boy despite the serious mission, revealing insecurity and lack of confidence.
Thanks Ford when offered help boarding the plane.
Checks Ford's gear and silently shares mutual reassurance.
Watches others trade cigarettes for chocolate with wonder and fear, internally anxious but not judgmental.
Takes Ford's hand and boards the plane despite fear.
Checks Ford's gear including detonator to ensure readiness.
Pale with fear, internal doubt about impending danger.
Wonders how others are so nonchalant facing danger.
Introduces himself confidently and initiates a handshake with new team members.
Shakes his head at a teammate's cynical comment, showing calmness and perhaps better judgment.
Questions Ford's refusal to take the air-sickness pill, showing awareness of its importance.
Displays a moment of prayer and mental preparation before the mission.
Lowers his head in prayer with the men before the mission, joining in collective hope and faith.
Quietly acknowledges Ford's written morale-boosting message on the fuselage floor with 'Amen.'
Prepares a bulky envelope addressed to his family, showing care and responsibility toward loved ones before danger.
Keeps praying calmly and silently under high stress while others are tense.
Opens his eyes at the moment Ford writes the message, indicating awareness and focus.
Appears petrified during takeoff, showing signs of fear or hesitation.
Keeps his eyes down and remains calm and quiet during heavy anti-aircraft fire, showing composure and focus.
Eyes the jump-lights carefully, indicating attention to important operational details despite the chaos.
Reassures comrades confidently by saying 'You won't hafta look to find me,' showing self-assurance and readiness.
Eyes Ford with awe after Ford breaks tension with humor among terrified men.
Stares horrified at the dead paratrooper outside the plane, showing empathy and shock.
Hesitates to jump from the plane despite urgent orders and encouragement from others, showing fear and reluctance.
Grabs Ford and pulls him out of the plane before it explodes.
Focuses on survival underwater, struggling alone, with no indication of selfishness or panic at others' expense.
Saves Dawes, checks on his condition, shows concern and insists they find everyone.
Cuts free from parachute harness and equipment quickly and effectively; assembles rifle and checks ammo, grenades, and compass before moving forward.
Uses the metal cricket signaling device repeatedly to try to contact others, demonstrating persistence and battlefield communication skills.
Moves cautiously and stays low in hostile territory while hearing gunfire, showing tactical awareness.
Immediately checks on downed paratrooper Dawes, assessing his condition and encouraging movement, showing leadership and responsiveness.
Welcomes Tibbet back with a simple 'Welcome' upon hearing the cricket chirp.
Immediately responds to Ford's call for help and starts climbing the tree to rescue him.
Shows concern by asking Tibbet about the group's status and Gurkin's safety.
Keeps climbing under enemy fire despite feeling exposed; tries to retrieve rifle when attacked.
Fails to hold on properly while cutting Ford loose, causing Ford to fall.
Quick reaction to catch Ford after his fall, preventing further injury.
Looks disappointed in himself for losing grip on rifle and the subsequent events.
Calmly observes the situation, stays still and quiet to avoid detection, watches over Ford and others without panicking.
Eyes Chloe when she rises to respond to the sergeant and leaves the group abandoned, but does not show outright distrust or aggression.
Acknowledges the capture of Rosenfeld with concern, indicating empathy for a comrade.
Remains calm and still during a dangerous situation, carefully observes surroundings and others' behavior.
Keeps silent and does not alert the enemy while under threat.
Shows awareness of bad omens (dead squirrel) indicating situational intuition.
Does not rush into action when Ford wants to start firing, indicating measured judgment.
Trails cautiously behind the half-track with his team, maintaining distance and remaining observant.
Listens to Chloe's presence as a potential signal but does not immediately act impulsively.
Does not take immediate leadership or offer solutions when the team pauses after seeing the POWs entering the church and the half-track proceeding.
Regards Chloe with a mild compliment, saying 'If she's France, I like France.'
Suggests not splitting up for safety reasons.
Teasingly compares Chloe's attractiveness to Eva Braun.
Suggests that the group should not split up, showing caution and consideration for team safety.
Engages in light banter about Chloe's appearance despite the seriousness of the situation, indicating a lapse in situational awareness.
Moves cautiously with Tibbet to find help while avoiding detection.
Observes the disaster and the wreckage of the downed plane with solemn respect and reflection.
Chooses to stay up top to cover comrades' backs instead of following them down the dangerous ramp.
Feels that investigating the ramp with dead bodies is a horrible idea but remains silent instead of voicing concern.
Recognizes the danger of going down the dark ramp with Chase and Penner and prefers to stay up top to cover their backs.
Remains silent despite sensing that Chase’s idea to go down the ramp might be a horrible idea, not voicing objection or proposing an alternative.
Stops to examine a dagger with disturbing symbols but pockets it quietly without comment or judgment.
Shows concern immediately after rifle fire by asking about Penner and inquires about his condition.
Stands watch 20 feet back, not advancing into the danger with the others.
Registers the sudden silence and quickly decides to look for Lew, showing awareness and responsiveness in a chaotic situation.
Checks watch anxiously and determines Ford is in trouble, then initiates action to find him, demonstrating situational awareness and prompt decision-making.
Does not appear to have a clear plan besides reactive movements and vague commands; relies on others for information and appears uncertain about unfolding events.
Expresses relief and concern upon seeing Ford crawling and injured, hurries to help him despite danger.
Insists on taking care of Ford instead of letting him hide alone, shows protective and loyal behavior.
Refuses to leave Ford behind despite his injury, insists on staying together.
Shows concern and care about Ford's safety over the mission alone.
Stands firm against Ford's insistence to go alone, expressing loyalty and support.
Insists on not leaving a wounded comrade behind despite orders, shows loyalty and concern, vocalizes suspicions about enemy activity, engages actively in planning mission approach.
Reluctant to adapt to mission limitations (unable to bring wounded Ford) but ultimately agrees to a plan, demonstrates some hesitation but maintains focus on mission objectives.
Helps Ford toward the back door silently and supportively despite danger.
Helps Ford, who has a broken ankle, by supporting him toward the back door without hesitation or complaint.
Moves cautiously with Ford inside a hostile environment, ducking into shadows to avoid detection by a searchlight beam.
Suggests possibly getting Paul and Kiebel out of harm's way, showing concern and situational awareness.
Nods at Ford's rebuke and accepts the practicality of focusing on the mission first.
About to probe Chloe's statement 'Was?' about the crutch then stops, showing restraint or deference to the situation.
Takes out the envelope addressed to his parents 'just in case' before going into a dangerous situation.
Nods to Ford and follows orders despite being scared, showing trust and respect.
Nods confidently when reminded how to set the charges, indicating understanding.
Expresses fear but proceeds with the mission despite dread.
Pulls out the envelope to give to Ford before entering a dangerous situation, showing foresight and responsibility.
Pauses momentarily before entering, possibly showing hesitation or doubt.
Expresses sympathy to Chloe upon hearing about her father and village suffering.
Acknowledges Chloe's request with a promise to destroy the church, showing respect for her wishes and the tragedy they share.
Leaves hastily without saying goodbye, despite the connection made with Chloe.
Focuses on practical survival preparations, seemingly emotionally reserved.
Watches the horrific medical examination in stunned disbelief, wincing with Ford at the removal of Guillaume’s fingernail.
Nods to Ford acknowledging the need to move when Ford gestures and checks his watch.
Watches the medical examination calmly and reacts appropriately to shocking events without panic.
Stares in disbelief and appears dazed during critical moments.
Understands the urgency of the situation, acknowledges the need to move quickly, and prepares to act accordingly.
Eyes Ford warningly to prevent him from shooting Wafner impulsively.
Acts quickly to cover Wafner's mouth and control the situation after Ford stabs Wafner, protecting Chloe and others in the room.
Throws bleeding Wafner up the attic steps to secure him
Takes initiative to tie Wafner's hands and feet
Participates in a violent confrontation leading to Wafner being restrained
Is knocked and disarmed by Wafner, struggling physically and losing control of his weapon.
After being pushed away, recovers to assist in restraining Wafner by throwing him into a chair and tying his hands and feet securely.
Expresses shock at Ford's violent torture of Wafner, does not participate or encourage.
Remains silent and passive while Ford tortures Wafner instead of intervening.
Boyce is shocked by Ford’s brutal interrogation but takes no further action, remaining silent and frozen.
Attempts to engage in the conversation with 'You too?,' showing some awareness of events.
Expresses shock and concern at the torture scene (slack-jawed: 'Are we about to KILL this guy?')
Remains silent and passive during the intense interrogation and torture.
Questions Ford about the situation calmly, seeks clarification about experiments and troop numbers.
Appears slack-jawed and silent during Ford's aggressive interrogation tactics, showing some hesitation or shock.
Chooses to remain silent after Ford removes the knife and continues questioning, possibly indicating composure under stress.
Promptly gathers his gear and heads down the stairs after being given a clear mission by Ford, demonstrating readiness and responsiveness.
Stops momentarily at the attic steps, possibly due to distraction as Chloe unexpectedly kisses him, indicating a lapse in focus at a critical moment.
Feels brave momentarily and attempts a confident joke to lighten tense interaction with Chloe's family despite pressure.
Deflates emotionally when challenged by Paul, showing a moment of doubt and reduced confidence.
Silently steels himself and prays before moving out into dangerous terrain during D-Day, demonstrating focus and mental preparation in a high-stakes moment.
Carefully sneaks away from town while villagers are distracted, avoiding danger to himself without causing alarm or harm to others.
Ducks behind a barn, moves cautiously and uses distractions to slip away from the town unnoticed.
Breathes shallow and anxious while scaling the foothill, indicating some nervousness but still proceeds with the plan.
Hurries trying to be invisible, finds a ridgeline to shoot from, indicating readiness to kill.
Witnesses Annelise's suicide with eyes wide, visibly shocked and unable to believe it.
Moves cautiously, trying to be invisible while scouting the area, finds a strategic vantage point overlooking the church grounds.
Eyes wide, can't believe Annelise's sudden suicide, showing surprise and lack of preparation for unexpected events.
Eyes the radio-jamming tower and lays out his trench knife and grenades carefully, catching the sun on the knife reflecting twice, showing attention to detail and preparation.
Pulls the pins on two grenades and throws them strategically at the church's back door and roof, demonstrating clear tactical thinking and decisiveness.
Steadies himself before taking action, indicating self-control and confidence under pressure.
Initiates return fire during the ambush immediately, showing readiness and quick response.
Remains perfectly still and low to the ground after the ambush, demonstrating tactical awareness and caution.
Warily enters the church through the damaged back door to investigate, indicating careful and deliberate movement in a dangerous environment.
Observes the bodies and notes the absence of Dr. Bruel, showing attention to detail.
No mistakes, hesitation, or confusion shown despite high stress situation; maintains calm and proceeds methodically.
Proceeds cautiously through an unfamiliar, dimly-lit environment, systematically checking rooms for threats or important items.
Finds and uses a light switch in a pitch-black room, illuminating a large laboratory area.
Does not immediately engage with the military radio or armory, instead prioritizes moving forward to find the Doctor.
Turns off the gas stove carefully before investigating further.
Moves cautiously and observes the horrifying lab setup in detail, noticing key elements like patient files, camera, and autojectors.
Seems shocked and speechless upon witnessing the gruesome scene, possibly momentarily overwhelmed.
Remains silent and does not reveal information under interrogation despite pressure.
Is captured and tied to an operating table; incapacitated and awaiting the outcome.
Remains silent and stoic under interrogation and torture, tries to subtly wiggle his tied wrist to gain some mobility without alerting captors.
Fails to verbally deflect or convincingly mislead Bruel during questioning; only manages a brief exchange that does not disrupt Bruel's control.
Keeps working urgently to free himself despite severe torture and agony.
Keeps praying silently and does not betray information under torture.
Shows no malice or retaliation toward his tormentors; focused on escape and survival.
Silently endures extreme pain without divulging information despite torture.
Works urgently and skillfully to free his hand during torture, taking advantage of a distraction.
Panicked but quickly runs to help Rosenfeld, carries him in a fireman's carry to safety.
Hears gunshot and immediately reacts by running to help Rosenfeld and carrying him in a fireman's carry to safety.
Successfully navigates through difficult terrain (past granite slabs) and heads directly towards the back door he previously opened to facilitate escape.
Questions the explanation and shakes his head in disbelief, trying to logically assess the situation.
Suggests blowing up the tower impulsively instead of investigating further.
Holds back Ford from immediate violence, attempting to maintain control and order.
Expresses shock and disbelief when Ford kills Wafner and questions the morality of killing P.O.W.s.
Argues that killing P.O.W.'s is wrong and distinguishes their behavior from Nazis.
Passively hands the syringe to Ford without attempting to stop him or intervene further.
Apprehensive and shocked by Ford's brutal experiment; questions the morality of killing prisoners of war and expresses doubt about their violent methods.
Passively hands over the syringe to Ford despite misgivings; does not intervene or challenge effectively.
Engages in thoughtful dialogue questioning the ethical and strategic value of their actions; shows awareness of consequences.
Unable to stop or predict the outcome of Ford's experiment but quietly processes the astonishing result.
Swings a chair at Wafner to try to stop him after gunshots fail, showing quick physical response.
Looks dazed and comes to the same horrible conclusion as Ford about Wafner's invincibility, indicating situational awareness.
Does not successfully stop Wafner despite attempts; his physical attack is ineffective and Wafner continues.
Alerts Ford to mines in the pasture, enabling safe passage.
Shows awareness of unknown dangers inside the blast doors and expresses caution.
Half-nods to confirm he has the charges, indicating readiness.
Half-stops himself from vomiting despite the stressful situation.
Admits he wouldn't run into a burning building to save strangers, showing honesty about his own fears and limitations.
Gags involuntarily at a gruesome sight, showing a natural, human reaction rather than cold detachment.
Gags involuntarily and almost vomits at a tense moment.
Expresses honest self-doubt about his courage compared to others, showing self-awareness.
Maintains composure enough to proceed with mission despite fear and disturbing surroundings.
Shares a silent look with Ford, indicating non-verbal communication and situational awareness.
Follows Ford's lead to uncoil the fire hose and stop Scherzer non-lethally.
Stops uncoiling the hose when it squeaks loudly to avoid alerting the enemy.
Follows Ford's plan to use the fire hose to subdue Scherzer, uncoiling the hose despite the loud squeak and physical difficulty.
Raises his rifle to shoot but quickly obeys Ford's silent signal to withhold fire, showing restraint and awareness.
Offers his hand to Ford to help him up after a fall.
Offers his hand to help Ford up after a fall, showing camaraderie and presence of mind.
Fires rifle instinctively at Kiebel but it has no effect, showing limited effectiveness in that moment.
Unable to stop Kiebel’s chokehold despite struggle, showing a limit to physical control under extreme threat.
Pushes the enemy off violently to save himself and Ford, showing determination and resilience.
Nods in agreement with Ford suggesting to abandon Chloe, showing pragmatic acceptance rather than emotional involvement.
Shares half the German potato mashers with Ford.
Shines flashlight to illuminate the lab for Ford in brief bursts.
Notices Bruel’s missing body and alerts Ford about unaccounted bodies.
Begins to untie the severely injured female villager despite her lack of response.
Shows hesitation but proceeds to untie a growling male creature.
Shines flashlight into the lab to illuminate the space in brief bursts for Ford, showing tactical awareness and caution.
Notices five unoccupied concrete slabs among those where dead Germans were found, recognizing an inconsistency.
Reacting instantly and shining flashlight on the spot where Bruel's body previously was, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Begins untying severely injured female villager despite her lack of response, showing initiative but perhaps some naivety regarding the situation.
Recoils briefly at the growling male villager but completes untying, demonstrating resolve despite understandable hesitation.
Moves nearer, untying a tortured inhabitant stuck on a toppled bed despite dangerous circumstances.
Protects Ford by attacking two German soldiers to save him from being shot, showing selflessness and bravery.
Successfully uses a grenade (potato masher) to disrupt advancing enemies despite heavy fire.
Quickly adapts to the situation by switching to melee weapons when firearms are not an option.
Demonstrates stealth and tactical approach by crawling and positioning behind enemies during gunfire.
Decapitates one enemy and disables the other efficiently with axe strikes under pressure.
Reacts calmly and decisively despite surprise gunfire and chaotic environment.
Decisively beheads enemy efficiently ending immediate threat.
Responds to orders quickly and follows instructions to find Chloe and get her out.
Unaware of Ford slipping something into his pocket, showing momentary lapse in situational awareness.
Attempts to rescue Chloe by approaching Wafner despite danger.
Shows fear but continues to confront Wafner to protect Chloe.
Grabs Chloe, pulls her along railing while ducking gunfire, leading her to safety.
Tosses a grenade to try to protect from enemies.
Grabs Chloe's hand to lead her into a safe room despite being trapped and under fire.
Reassures Chloe when she says they're going to die.
Barricades door and fights off undead Nazis to protect Chloe.
Takes charge in a dangerous situation, encourages Chloe to move away from danger.
Grabs Chloe's hand and leads her to safety after fighting the Nazis.
Barricades the door with a locker to hold off enemies.
Notices items falling from the locker and seizes an opportunity.
Allows the door to be breached intentionally to use a flamethrower against enemies.
Effectively uses the flamethrower to neutralize multiple threats.
Leads Chloe to safety amid the chaos.
Runs out of flamethrower fuel at a critical moment.
Charges enemies with bayonet and throws grenade into armory to ensure destruction.
Commands Chloe to leave the dangerous area immediately despite her desire to help.
Shows recognition and brief moment of pause upon learning the creature is Chloe's father, but insists Chloe cannot help him and must leave.
Charges the enemy with his bayonet, kills two opponents, drives them into the armory, then uses a grenade to blow up the armory and stop the threat.
Quickly commands Chloe to leave the dangerous area, showing clear situational awareness and prioritization.
Pauses briefly to assess the diseased and barely alive creature at his feet (Alain Laurent) and recognizes the importance of the situation before proceeding.
Drags the creature out of the doorway to prevent obstruction and danger, then insists Chloe evacuate for her safety, demonstrating decisiveness under pressure.
Does not engage emotionally with Chloe’s distress or try to argue her out of staying; instead focuses on the mission and disappears into the lab.
Tries repeatedly to get a response from Flash, showing concern.
Freezes in fear but tries to communicate and understand Ford's condition, seeking clarity.
Does not resort to aggression despite Ford’s threatening approach, attempts dialogue.
Shows hope and unwillingness to accept Ford's changed state without proof.
Attempts repeatedly to reason with Ford, calling him by name and reminding him of his true identity, despite being fired upon.
Expresses horror and hesitation when Ford fires at him, showing reluctance to harm a friend.
Butt-ends Ford with his rifle only as a last resort to stop him from advancing threateningly.
Does not retaliate aggressively despite being shot at multiple times, continuously tries to de-escalate the situation.
Repeatedly strikes Ford to try to stop him despite emotional distress and physical danger, demonstrating determination and some combat skill.
Acknowledges the mission and appears ready to complete it when offered the grenade wired to explosives, showing mission focus.
Hesitates and is speechless when confronted with the choice to complete the mission at the cost of his own life, revealing uncertainty and lack of readiness for ultimate sacrifice.
Pulls the pin of a grenade defiantly, signaling unity with Ford by saying 'We stick together, right?'
Stares down imminent death without running or closing his eyes.
Reminds Ford of their shared past and the significance of D-Day, attempting to reach his better nature.
Pulls the pin on the grenade and holds it up defiantly, showing resolve and leadership under extreme pressure.
Stays composed and does not run or shut his eyes as the grenade counts down, demonstrating mental fortitude and confidence.
Responds quickly to the dud grenade and uses the moment to trigger Ford's memory with a timely reminder, showing situational awareness and psychological insight.
Begins to follow Ford's command to run when the lighter is revealed, showing appropriate responsiveness and quick decision-making.
Despite being wounded and weak, Boyce manages to steady himself and take steps, showing resilience and physical capability.
He promptly seeks out Chloe and interacts with her empathetically, indicating presence of mind and emotional intelligence despite his condition.
He responds calmly and respectfully when Grunauer orders him back to bed, showing discipline and ability to follow military chain of command.
Looks around at wounded soldiers and considers what Ford would have done to help them before resting.
Engages the wounded G.I.'s with humor despite his own condition, lifting morale.
Hands back the WWI medal for valor to Chloe, indicating humility or reluctance to claim unearned honor.
